snippet: At a time when the N.F.L. finds itself reacting to one moral crisis after another, Dan Snyder, the Redskins owner, is a symbol and a product of the erosion of an industry whose highest value is profit and preservation of the institution.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column contends that Washington Redskins owner Dan Snyder is worst owner in sports; notes that he has ruined team as competitive entity and stubbornly refused to change racist nickname.
lead_paragraph: At a time when the N.F.L. finds itself reacting to one moral crisis after another, Dan Snyder, the Redskins owner, is a symbol and a product of the erosion of an industry whose highest value is profit and preservation of the institution.

headline.main: History Continues to Repeat for a Struggling Franchise
headline.print_headline: History Continues to Repeat for a Struggling Franchise
